00253 /**
00254  * cvmx_xcv_dll_ctl
00255  *
00256  * The RGMII timing specification requires that devices transmit clock and
00257  * data synchronously. The specification requires external sources (namely
00258  * the PC board trace routes) to introduce the appropriate 1.5 to 2.0 ns of
00259  * delay.
00260  *
00261  * To eliminate the need for the PC board delays, the RGMII interface has optional
00262  * on-board DLLs for both transmit and receive. For correct operation, at most one
00263  * of the transmitter, board, or receiver involved in an RGMII link should
00264  * introduce delay. By default/reset, the RGMII receivers delay the received clock,
00265  * and the RGMII transmitters do not delay the transmitted clock. Whether this
00266  * default works as-is with a given link partner depends on the behavior of the
00267  * link partner and the PC board.
00268  *
00269  * These are the possible modes of RGMII receive operation:
00270  *
00271  * * XCV_DLL_CTL[CLKRX_BYP] = 0 (reset value) - The RGMII
00272  * receive interface introduces clock delay using its internal DLL.
00273  * This mode is appropriate if neither the remote
00274  * transmitter nor the PC board delays the clock.
00275  *
00276  * * XCV_DLL_CTL[CLKRX_BYP] = 1, [CLKRX_SET] = 0x0 - The
00277  * RGMII receive interface introduces no clock delay. This mode
00278  * is appropriate if either the remote transmitter or the PC board
00279  * delays the clock.
00280  *
00281  * These are the possible modes of RGMII transmit operation:
00282  *
00283  * * XCV_DLL_CTL[CLKTX_BYP] = 1, [CLKTX_SET] = 0x0 (reset value) -
00284  * The RGMII transmit interface introduces no clock
00285  * delay. This mode is appropriate is either the remote receiver
00286  * or the PC board delays the clock.
00287  *
00288  * * XCV_DLL_CTL[CLKTX_BYP] = 0 - The RGMII transmit
00289  * interface introduces clock delay using its internal DLL.
00290  * This mode is appropriate if neither the remote receiver
00291  * nor the PC board delays the clock.
00292  */
00293 union cvmx_xcv_dll_ctl {
00294     uint64_t u64;
00295     struct cvmx_xcv_dll_ctl_s {
00296 #ifdef __BIG_ENDIAN_BITFIELD
00297     uint64_t reserved_32_63               : 32;
00298     uint64_t lock                         : 1;  /**< Reserved. */
00299     uint64_t clk_set                      : 7;  /**< The clock delay as determined by the on-board hardware DLL. */
00300     uint64_t clkrx_byp                    : 1;  /**< Bypass the RX clock delay setting.
00301                                                          Skews RXC from RXD, RXCTL.
00302                                                          By default, hardware internally shifts the RXC clock
00303                                                          to sample RXD,RXCTL assuming clock and data and
00304                                                          sourced synchronously from the link partner. */
00305     uint64_t clkrx_set                    : 7;  /**< RX clock delay setting to use in bypass mode.
00306                                                          Skews RXC from RXD. */
00307     uint64_t clktx_byp                    : 1;  /**< Bypass the TX clock delay setting.
00308                                                          Skews TXC from TXD, TXCTL.
00309                                                          By default, clock and data and sourced
00310                                                          synchronously. */
00311     uint64_t clktx_set                    : 7;  /**< TX clock delay setting to use in bypass mode.
00312                                                          Skews TXC from TXD. */
00313     uint64_t reserved_2_7                 : 6;
00314     uint64_t refclk_sel                   : 2;  /**< Select the reference clock to use.  Normal RGMII specification requires a 125MHz
00315                                                          oscillator.
00316                                                          To reduce system cost, a 500MHz coprocessor clock can be divided down and remove the
00317                                                          requirements for the external oscillator. Additionally, in some well defined systems, the
00318                                                          link partner may be able to source the RXC. The RGMII would operate correctly in 1000Mbs
00319                                                          mode only.
00320                                                          0x0 = RGMII REFCLK.
00321                                                          0x1 = RGMII RXC (1000Mbs only).
00322                                                          0x2 = Divided coprocessor clock.
00323                                                          0x3 = Reserved. */
00324 #else
00325     uint64_t refclk_sel                   : 2;
00326     uint64_t reserved_2_7                 : 6;
00327     uint64_t clktx_set                    : 7;
00328     uint64_t clktx_byp                    : 1;
00329     uint64_t clkrx_set                    : 7;
00330     uint64_t clkrx_byp                    : 1;
00331     uint64_t clk_set                      : 7;
00332     uint64_t lock                         : 1;
00333     uint64_t reserved_32_63               : 32;
00334 #endif
00335     } s;
00336     struct cvmx_xcv_dll_ctl_s             cn73xx;
00337 };
00338 typedef union cvmx_xcv_dll_ctl cvmx_xcv_dll_ctl_t;
